title: New Challenges In Fighting AIDS
body:
To the Editor:

     Your Aug. 19 front-page article "With Fears Fading, More Gays Spurn Old Preventive Message" sheds light on 
the fact that developments in AIDS treatment and education have also created corresponding challenges. 

But it is important to note that the complexities of risk-taking and decision-making are exacerbated for those 
confronting racism, poverty and homophobia. 

 These forces, along with limited access to health care and support, conspire both to inflate risk in their lives and 
constrict decision-making dramatically, resulting in a disparately high rate of H.I.V. infection and AIDS in gay 
communities of color, especially African-American and Latino communities.

ANA OLIVEIRA

Executive Director

Gay Men's Health Crisis

New York, Aug. 23, 2001

http://www.nytimes.com
